definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)

sentences.english: Angelique cups her lips around Lenny's heel, and Lenny starts to moan.

sentences.english: I was kicked out because I bit the heel of a child.

sentences.english: But when he got acrossthe hedge, he hurt his heel.

sentences.english: Medical and science community seriously talk about "cushioning" by landing on the heel.
sentences.chinese: 醫學和科學組織不無嚴肅地提及腳後跟着地時的緩衝。

sentences.english: Start with the bottoms of your palms by clasping your fingers and rubbing the heels of your palms together in a circular motion.

sentences.english: My heel slips out of my running shoe with every pair I buy.

sentences.english: He heeled me, so I didn't say.

sentences.english: What reason is wanting to ask next my calcaneal the muscle above aches?
sentences.chinese: 想問下我的腳後跟上面的筋疼是什麼原因？

sentences.english: Where would your heel touch the ground?

sentences.chinese: 小孩用腳後跟將他絆倒。
